title: 115_hr1875
content: The Act titled "Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund Act of 2017" establishes a fund for contributions to assist homeless veterans. Individuals can designate a portion of their tax overpayment (minimum $1) to the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund and make additional contributions to the Fund when filing their tax return or at a later time as specified by the Secretary. Individuals can designate a portion of their tax overpayment to the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund as prescribed by the Secretary. The overpayment designated shall be treated as refunded to the taxpayer and a contribution to the United States on the date of filing the tax return. The United States amends the Internal Revenue Code to create the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund. The United States creates the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund under SEC. 9512. The Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States to provide services to homeless veterans through the Department of Veterans Affairs, Department of Labor Veterans' Employment and Training Service, and Department of Housing and Urban Development. The Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund aims to prevent and end veteran homelessness by supporting programs administered by the Department of Veterans Affairs, Department of Labor Veterans' Employment and Training Service, and Department of Housing and Urban Development. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs can transfer funds to these departments for programs serving homeless veterans. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs, in collaboration with the Secretary of Labor and the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, must provide a detailed expenditure plan for the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund to the relevant committees 60 days before any expenditure. Starting from the President's annual budget submission for fiscal year 2019, the Departments of Veterans Affairs, Labor, and Housing and Urban Development must report on the previous year's fund usage and propose the next year's fund allocation. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include new item in the table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 61 for the next fiscal year. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new item in the table of sections for subchapter A of chapter 98, creating the "Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund." The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment of this Act.
